title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 800.17 - Responsibility for loss or damage
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 800.17 - Responsibility for loss or damage

State Regulations

The commission will not be responsible for damage to or loss
of any freight being loaded or unloaded, at the public wharfs and will not be
responsible for any delay to same, nor for damage to freight on its wharfs, in
its sheds, warehouses, or in or on any Port facility by fire, leakage, or
discharge of water from sprinkler fire protection system, collapse of building, rats, mice, moths, weevils, frost or the elements and acts of God nor will it
be answerable for any delay, loss or damage arising from insufficient
notification or from war, insurrection, shortage of labor, combinations, or
riots or strikes of any persons in their own employ or in the service of
others, nor from any consequences arising therefrom. Steamship companies
arranging to use open wharfs shall be required to furnish watchmen at all times
when they have freight on said open wharves. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
800.17

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
